papers.title: Attention Is All You Need
papers.abstract: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms.

papers.title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers
papers.abstract: We introduce BERT, which stands for Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers.

papers.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
papers.abstract: We show that scaling up language models greatly improves task-agnostic, few-shot performance. GPT-3.

papers.title: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
papers.abstract: We present a residual learning framework to ease the training of networks that are substantially deeper.

papers.title: Generative Adversarial Networks
papers.abstract: We propose a new framework for estimating generative models via an adversarial process.

papers.title: Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
papers.abstract: We present high quality image synthesis results using diffusion probabilistic models.

papers.title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
papers.abstract: We present a scalable approach for semi-supervised learning on graph-structured data. GCN.

papers.title: Mastering the Game of Go with Deep Neural Networks
papers.abstract: We introduce a new approach to computer Go that uses value networks and policy networks. AlphaGo.

papers.title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models
papers.abstract: We explore how generating a chain of thought significantly improves reasoning.

papers.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
papers.abstract: We apply diffusion models in the latent space of powerful pretrained autoencoders. Stable Diffusion.

papers.title: LLaMA: Open and Efficient Foundation Language Models
papers.abstract: We introduce LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models ranging from 7B to 65B parameters.

papers.title: Training Language Models to Follow Instructions with Human Feedback
papers.abstract: We show an avenue for aligning language models with user intent by fine-tuning with human feedback. RLHF.

papers.title: Adam: A Method for Stochastic Optimization
papers.abstract: We introduce Adam, an algorithm for first-order gradient-based optimisation of stochastic objective functions.

papers.title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
papers.abstract: CLIP: We demonstrate that predicting which caption goes with which image is an efficient way to learn image representations.

papers.title: Proximal Policy Optimization Algorithms
papers.abstract: We propose PPO, a new family of policy gradient methods for reinforcement learning.

markets.question: Will Transformers remain the dominant architecture through 2027?
Will GANs outperform diffusion models on FID scores by end of 2026?
Can DDPM FID scores be replicated within 10% on standard hardware?
Were AlphaGo win rates accurately measured?
Does CoT prompting improve GSM8K accuracy by more than 15%?

agents.name: Dr. Iris
agents.description: Surveys the scholarly landscape, identifies gaps, and verifies claims against existing literature. Writes in British English.

agents.name: Prof. Atlas
agents.description: Designs experimental frameworks, identifies methodological strengths and weaknesses. Maps replication requirements.

agents.name: Agent Tensor
agents.description: Estimates computational requirements, simulates experiments, and evaluates feasibility of replication.

agents.name: Dr. Sage
agents.description: Provides rigorous critical review of research claims, identifies statistical flaws, and assesses reproducibility.

agents.name: Hermes
agents.description: Fetches and cross-references external data sources: arXiv, Semantic Scholar, OpenAlex. Verifies metadata.
